title: The compactified D-brane cylinder amplitude and T duality
abstract:
In this paper, we address how to implement T duality to the closed string
tree cylinder amplitude between a Dp brane and a Dp$'$ brane with $p - p' = 2
\,n$. For this, we first compute the closed string tree cylinder amplitude
between these two D branes with common longitudinal and transverse circle
compactifications. We then show explicitly how to perform a T duality to this
amplitude along either a longitudinal or a transverse compactified direction to
both branes. In the decompactification limit, we show that either the
compactified cylinder amplitude or the T dual compactified cylinder one gives
the known non-compactified one as expected.
